2.text: Are you, therefore, alone among men, and will wisdom die with you?

3.text: And I have a heart just as you also do, and I am not inferior to you. For who is ignorant of these things, which you know?

4.text: He who is mocked by his friends as I am, will call upon God, and he will listen to him because it is the sincerity of the just that is being mocked.

5.text: The lamp that is despised in the thoughts of the rich is ready for the appointed time.

6.text: The tabernacles of robbers are numerous, and they provoke God boldly; whereas, it is he who has given all things into their hands.

7.text: In truth, ask the mules, and they will teach you, and the birds of the sky, and they will reveal to you.

8.text: Speak with the earth, and it will respond to you, and the fish of the sea will explain.

9.text: Who is ignorant that the hand of the Lord has made all these things?

10.text: In his hand is the soul of all the living and the spirit of all the flesh of mankind.

11.text: Does not the ear perceive words, and the palate, when eating, perceive flavor?

12.text: In old age is wisdom, and in length of days is prudence.

13.text: With him is wisdom and strength, he has counsel and understanding.

14.text: If he tears down, there is no one who can build up; if he encloses a man, there is no one who can open.

15.text: If he restrains the waters, everything will dry up; and if he sends them forth, they will subdue the land.

16.text: With him is strength and wisdom; he knows both the deceiver and he who is deceived.

17.text: He leads advisors to a foolish end and judges to stupidity.

18.text: He removes the belt of kings and encircles their waist with a rope.

19.text: He leads away priests in dishonor and displaces nobles,

20.text: altering the lips of those who speak the truth and sweeping away the teaching of the aged.

21.text: He pours distain upon the leaders, relieving those who had been oppressed.

22.text: He reveals the depths of the darkness, and he brings the shadow of death into the light.

23.text: He multiplies peoples, and destroys them, and, having been overthrown, he restores them anew.

24.text: He transforms the heart of the leaders of the people on earth, and misleads those who in vain advance upon the inviolable.

25.text: They will grope as in the darkness, not the light, and he will make them stagger like drunkards.
